intro: Hesperis flexuosa, commonly known as the meadow gentian, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often sprawling or ascending. Hesperis flexuosa blooms from late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
